Implements SUI blockchain integration for the tBTC v2 SDK, enabling Bitcoin deposits on SUI through the Wormhole-based cross-chain protocol.

## Changes

- Add SUI chain definitions and types
- Implement SuiBitcoinDepositor for deposit initialization on SUI

- Add SuiAddress identifier for 32-byte SUI addresses
- Add SuiExtraDataEnc

- Added tests for SUI-related functionalities to ensure reliability and correctness.
- Updated README and usage examples for SUI integration.

prs.title: Fix float64 unmarshal precision
prs.truncated_body:
This PR fixes a precision loss issue when processing large timestamp values in genesis JSON files. The issue occurred when unmarshaling JSON into `map[string]interface{}`, which by default converts numbers to `float64`, causing precision loss for large integers like `9223372036854775807`.

**Test plan**

Update `testing/files/eth-genesis.json` and set the follwing:

>   "pragueTime": 9223372

commits.message: fix(cli/genesis): preserve precision for large timestamp values

prs.title: Thread safety audit
prs.truncated_body:
# Description

Resolves #4774

This fixes a few errors from clang's static thread safety analyzer. We have this enabled in CI, but it looks like clang-12 is pretty outdated and doesn't catch several classes of errors that are covered in newer versions. To help strengthen our CI, I've added a new job that just compiles core with clang-19 with static analysis enabled. We should investigate updat

feat: implement core storage transaction support + in-memory implementation (#1674)

## Description

Breakout from the larger PR #1673

## Changes

**Note:** This PR _only_ affects test-related code. The new transactions
are _not used_ in any actual tests here (see the other PR for that),
with the exception of the handful of new tests explicitly testing the
transactional functionality for the in-mem store.

Highlights:
- `SharedStore` now implements `Transactable` which lets you call
`begin_transaction()` to get an `InMemoryTransaction` handle, which you
can `commit()` or `rollback()`.
- `DbRead` is implemented for both `SharedStore` and
`InMemoryTransaction` in `read.rs`.
- `DbWrite` is implemented for both `SharedStore` and
`InMemoryTransaction` in `write.rs`.
- The implementations for `InMemoryTransaction` are just delegating
calls to the `SharedStore` implementations, i.e. super boilerplate.

More details:
- Restructured the `storage` module a bit:
  - `in_memory.rs` migrated to `memory` folder.
_(I had originally just named this `in_memory` but ran into issues with
the Emily container builds complaining about duplicate modules, despite
that not being true... 🤷 )_.
- Split `DbRead` and `DbWrite` implementations into `read.rs` and
`write.rs` to try to manage file size and separate the logical
implementations.
- Core "store" logic is in `store.rs` (i.e. `Store` and `SharedStore`).
- New traits:
- `Transactable`: Implemented for stores which can create transactions
(i.e. our `SharedStore` and `PgStore`).
  - `TransactionHandle`: Implemented for transaction handle types
- New types:
- `InMemoryTransaction`: Represents a transaction for the in-memory
database and implements `TransactionHandle`. It uses a simple, naive
optimistic concurrency check for concurrent transactions. Also
implements `DbRead` and `DbWrite`.
- `SharedStore` now implements `Transactable`, giving it
`begin_transaction()` capabilities.

Add Workflow to Deploy Emily (#1681)

This PR deploys emily off specific branches (ones that match the
`environment/*` pattern).

Requirements:
- [x] Add environments in the `sbtc` repository each containing the
required environment variables and secrets for the respective
environment (the environment names have to match the branch names from
which the deployment is made):
  - `environment/devnet`
  - `environment/staging`
  - `environment/private-mainnet`
  - `environment/mainnet`
- `approve-emily-deployment` (used only to require a manual approval
before the deployment takes place, no variables/secrets have to be added
here)
  
Workflow jobs:
- `Build & Diff Emily` - This job prints a diff of the changes in GitHub
Step Summary, which has to be reviewed before proceeding
- `Approve Emily Deployment` - This job waits for the manual approval of
the workflow before proceeding with the deployment
- `Deploy Emily` - This job builds Emily then deploys it, only runs
after the approval step is successful.

Test runs:
- Emily deployment to devnet through this workflow:
https://github.com/BowTiedDevOps/sbtc/actions/runs/15139506011
- Colored diff output in step summary (performed after the devnet
deployment, hence I've cancelled the workflow):
https://github.com/BowTiedDevOps/sbtc/actions/runs/15140197457#summary-42561938508

**IMPORTANT NOTE:** This PR can be safely merged, but the mentioned
environments have to be created before their respective deployment
branches are published.

feat: integral support for storage transactions + bitcoin transaction processing in transaction (#1673)

## Description

Closes: #1194

## Changes

> [!NOTE]
Like 95% of this PR's line count is due to moving/splitting up our
stores (`in_memory.rs` and `postgres.rs`). I _did not_ alter any SQL, so
the fact that current integration tests also remain unchanged (short of
some minor tweaks in `use` statements etc.) and are passing should give
a fairly solid indication that the refactor generally does not _break_
anything. As a reviewer I would probably put most of my focus on
ensuring that no malicious code has snuck into the diffs.

- Restructured the `storage` module a bit:
  - Two new folders: `memory` and `pgsql`.
_(I had originally just named these `in_memory` and `postgres` but ran
into issues with the Emily container builds... 🤷 )_.
- Split `DbRead` and `DbWrite` implementations into `read.rs` and
`write.rs` for both memory/pgsql.
  - Core "store" logic is in `store.rs` for both memory/pgsql.
- New traits:
- `Transactable`: Implemented for stores which can create transactions
(i.e. our `SharedStore` and `PgStore`).
  - `TransactionHandle`: Implemented for transaction handle types
- New types:
- `InMemoryTransaction`: Represents a transaction for the in-memory
database and implements `TransactionHandle`. It uses a simple, naive
optimistic concurrency check for concurrent transactions.
- `PgTransaction`: Represents an sqlx postgres transaction and
implements `TransactionHandle`.
  - For postgres:
- New `PgRead` and `PgWrite` types which implement the "core" queries
using postgres `Executor`s, which the `DbRead` and `DbWrite`
implementations now delegate to.
- This adds a bit more boilerplate when adding new `Db*` methods, but
keeps the actual SQL logic centralized.
- I did try to find ways to minimize this, but so far haven't succeeded
to find another solution that works across-the-board like this, so I'm
ending my time-box and PR'ing the current solution.
- **Wraps bitcoin block+tx handling in a transaction** in
`block_observer.rs`.
- Updated tests & test helpers due to the above changes.

prs.title: Remove finality cert table constraint in observer
prs.truncated_body:
Remove the primary key constraint in finality certs in observer to avoid an edge-case where multiple certs for the same instance may be discovered in conjunction with using duckdb appender to insert them.

Appender does not offer the ability to insert or ignore records. And even if it did, we probably want to capture all and any certs, since certs are validated before insertion.

While at it,

commits.message:
Remove finality cert table constraint in observer

Remove the primary key constraint in finality certs in observer to
avoid an edge-case where multiple certs for the same instance may be
discovered in conjunction with using duckdb appender to insert them.

Appender does not offer the ability to insert or ignore records. And
even if it did, we probably want to capture all and any certs, since
certs are validated before insertion.

While at it, also fix a typo in cert JSON struct tags.

prs.title: Capture chain exchange messages in F3 observer
prs.truncated_body:
Add the ability to capture chain exchange messages via F3 observer and make them queryable via SQL statement.

The captured chain exchange messages offers a mapping of EC chain key to the concrete EC chain value itself, since partial GMessages only contain the EC chain key and not the chain itself.

Fixes #970

commits.message:
Capture chain exchange messages in F3 observer

Add the ability to capture chain exchange messages via F3 observer and
make them queryable via SQL statement.

The captured chain exchange messages offers a mapping of EC chain key to
the concrete EC chain value itself, since partial GMessages only contain
the EC chain key and not the chain itself.

Fixes #970

## add EnablePaymentChannelManager config option to disable payment channel manager by default

- Added EnablePaymentChannelManager boolean field to FullNode config struct
- Set default value to false (disabled by default) since payment chan

commits.message:
feat(paych): add EnablePaymentChannelManager option & disable paych by default

This change introduces a new configuration option EnablePaymentChannelManager to control whether the payment channel manager is started on node startup.

- Added EnablePaymentChannelManager boolean field to FullNode config struct

- Set default value to false (disabled by default) since payment channels get minimal use on mainnet

- Added conditional wiring in node/builder_chain.go to only start payment channel manager when config option is enabled

- Updated config documentation with clear description of the option

This saves resources for light nodes and most full nodes that don't use payment channel functionality, while still allowing users to enable it when needed by setting EnablePaymentChannelManager: true in their config.

- Updated default-lotus-config.toml with proper documentation for the new EnablePaymentChannelManager option

npm run pragma # minimize pragma for all solidity files in contracts/ (mocks excluded)
npm run pragma -- -p 'contracts/accounts/**/*.sol' # minimize pragma for a given subfolder
npm run pragma -- -p 'contracts/utils/Address.sol' # minimize pragma for a gi

commits.message: Add script to automatically minimize pragma
